Class Operationer

java.lang.Object
math.core.Operationer
public class Operationer extends Object
Manages the operations and results of the four basic mathemathic operations. Intended to be only used as a stakeholder manager for its functions.

Provides core arithmetic operations for arbitrary-precision integer arithmetic using string-based number representation. This class implements fundamental mathematical operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) with support for precision control, comparison utilities, and zero-padding/trimming operations.

Key Features:

  • Arbitrary-Precision Arithmetic - Handles string-based integer numbers of any size limited only by memory
  • Full Operation Suite - Addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division with configurable precision
  • Comparison Utilities - Specialized methods for comparing integer and decimal components
  • Zero Management - Padding (left/right) and trimming (left/right) operations for number normalization
  • Asynchronous Processing - Parallel computation for large-number operations
  • Increment/Decrement Operations - Efficient string-based number modification
  • Division Utilities - Quotient/remainder calculation and decimal expansion with precision control

Usage Example:



		public class MyClass{

			private Operationer operationManager = new Operationer();

		}
Since:
v0.0.9

  • Method Details

    • compareIntegerParts

      protected int compareIntegerParts(String a, String b)
      Compares two positive integer numbers as two String.

      Usage Example 
      

			int result = this.operationManager.compareIntegerParts("45", "50");
      The return value will be result = -1
      Parameters:
      a - Integer number as a String
      b - Integer number as a String
      Returns:
      int Returns an x value ranging from -1<x<1 where x belongs to integers. Where 0 if both are equal, 1 if n>m and -1 if n<m.
      Since:
      v0.0.1

    • compareDecimalParts

      protected int compareDecimalParts(String a, String b)
      Compares two decimal parts as two positive integer numbers as two String.

      Usage Example 
      

			int result = this.operationManager.compareDecimalParts("5", "52");
      The return value will be result = 1
      Parameters:
      a - Integer number as a String
      b - Integer number as a String
      Returns:
      int Returns an x value ranging from -1<x<1 where x belongs to integers. Where 0 if both are equal, 1 if n<m and -1 if n>m.
      Since:
      v0.0.1

    • padZerosRight

      protected String padZerosRight(String str, int length)
      Add zeros to the String result to the right until the length matches the length parameter.

      Usage Example 
      

			String result = this.operationManager.padZerosRight("5", 3);
      The return value will be result = "500"
      Parameters:
      str - Integer number as a String
      length - Intented length for the String result.
      Returns:
      String Returns String that matches the length parameter.
      Since:
      v0.0.1

    • asyncAddition

      protected String asyncAddition(String[] integers)
      Adds integers as String logicly and sequentially.

      Usage Example 
      

			String result = this.operationManager.asyncAddition(new String[] {

				"1", "2", "3"

			});
      The return value will be result = "7"

      Note:
      1. The return value will have the same String length as the max String length value from the array.
      Parameters:
      integers - String array made out of positive integer numbers.
      Returns:
      String Result from the addition of the integers.
      Since:
      v0.0.3
      See Also:
      • addTwoTogether(String, String, boolean)

    • addTwoTogether

      protected String addTwoTogether(String thisInteger, String otherInteger, boolean isAddition)
      Adds two integers as String logicly and sequentially.

      Usage Example 
      

			String result = this.operationManager.addTwoTogether("5", "2", true);
      The return value will be result = "7"

      Notes:
      1. The String length relation between the parameters must satisfy thisInteger >= otherInteger.
      2. For subtraction, the relation between the integer parameters must satisfy thisInteger >= otherInteger.
      3. The return value will have the same String length as the String thisInteger length.
      Parameters:
      thisInteger - Positive integer number as String.
      otherInteger - Positive integer number as String.
      isAddition - Is addition or substraction as boolean.
      Returns:
      String Result from the addition of the integers.
      Since:
      v0.0.3
      See Also:
      • padZerosLeft(String, int)

    • increase

      protected String increase(String thisInteger)
      Increases the integer's value stored as a String by one.

      Usage Example 
      

			String result = this.operationManager.increase("0");
      The return value will be result = "1"

      Notes:
      1. The return value will have the same String length as the parameter's length.
      2. The parameter must satisfy thisInteger >= 0.
      Parameters:
      thisInteger - Positive integer number as String.
      Returns:
      String Parameter increased by one.
      Since:
      v0.0.3

      protected String decrease(String thisInteger)

      Usage Example 
      

			String result = this.operationManager.decrease("1");
      The return value will be result = "0"

      Notes:
      1. The return value will have the same String length as the parameter's length.
      2. The parameter must satisfy thisInteger >= 1.
      Parameters:
      thisInteger - Positive integer number as String.
      Returns:
      String Parameter decreased by one.
      Since:
      v0.0.3

			String result = this.operationManager.multiplication("12", "3");
      The return value will be result = "36"
      Parameters:

    • division

      protected String[] division(String dividend, String divisor, long precision)
      Divides integers as String logicly and sequentially.

      Usage Example 
      

			String[] result = this.operationManager.division("7", "5", 20);
      The return values will be result[0] = "1" and result[1] = "4"
      Parameters:
      dividend - Positive integer dividend as String.
      divisor - Positive integer divisor as String.
      precision - Decimal precision as long.
      Returns:
      String[] Two length array which conatains the result from the division of the integers, index 0 contains the integer part and index 1 the decimal part.
      Since:
      v0.0.1
      See Also:
      • compareIntegerParts(String, String)
      • quotient(String, String)
      • calculateDecimalPartForDivision(String, String, long)

    • quotient

      protected String[] quotient(String dividend, String divisor)
      Divides integers as String logicly and sequentially.

      Usage Example 
      

			String[] result = this.operationManager.quotient("7", "5");
      The return values will be result[0] = "1" and result[1] = "2"
      Parameters:
      dividend - Positive integer dividend as String.
      divisor - Positive integer divisor as String.
      Returns:
      String[] Two length array which conatains the result from the division of the integers, index 0 contains the quotient and index 1 the decimal remainder.
      Since:
      v0.0.4
      See Also:
